page.title: 01FRILSHAM & MARLSTON OUTLINE
page.content: This area of South{Berkshire}extends from the{M4 motorway}in the north to the River Pang in the south. It is the old Saxon Hundred of Faircross where two{ancient trade routes}crossed-one a branch of the Berkshire Ridgeway to Pangbourne, the other from Wallingford to Thatcham.There has probably been life in this area for some 4,000 years- since the time of Abraham. It is recorded in the original Domesday Book. It is bordered on the west by the woods of Wellhouse and on the east by those of High Copse. The main roads of the area cross at{Frilsham,}the main village eight miles from Newbury with no access to the M4. The minor roads are winding and narrow with steep banks full of ferns. The river Pang runs south through the area then east at Bucklebury Ford. It is a place of natural beauty unspoilt by change.
